Karen wrote:
> On 11/6/07, Etan Wexler <yahoo.com@...> wrote:
>> I've noticed that most of the discussion on rest-discuss is not about
>> REST, but about details of implementing HTTP.
> 
> In large part, though, isn't REST *about* the details of implementing HTTP?
> 
> Maybe that's just me.

Nope, HTTP isn't the only RESTful protocol possible and not all HTTP 
matters relate to REST.

That said, I have no beef with the topicality of the list (I'm 
notoriously bad as far as meandering off-topic goes, so I'm in no 
position to complain anyway). There's a more general matter though of 
people perhaps being led to think that the other HTTP matters we discuss 
here that aren't related to REST being REST.

I think that was Yohanes Santoso's point and it was certainly mine when 
I wrote agreeing with him. Quite a few people do seem to think that URI 
design has much more direct importance to REST than it does, and while 
it's reasonable for people interested in REST to ALSO be interested in 
URI design, and hence to end up discussing it here, it's perhaps harmful 
to have such an emphasis on it that we muddy the waters further.
